For all other use contact the Tennessee State Library and Archives, 403 Seventh Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243-0312. (615) 741-2764.

bibl.title: [Letter] 1849 Feb. 26, Nashville, Tennessee [to] Neill Brown / Capitol Building Commission
bibl.author: Bass, John M.
bibl.note: This document is a brief note to governor Neill S. Brown, dated February 26, 1849 communicating a decision of the Board of Commissioners in charge of overseeing the construction of the state house in Nashville, to issue bonds of the state in the amount of fifty-thousand dollars for the construction of the building.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div.p:
At a meeting of the Board of Commissioners to superintend the construction of the state House, present
Jno John M Bass,
Wm William Brown, SD Morgan, James Woods and A A Hall, on motion it was

Resolved, that the Governor of the State be requested to issue Bonds of the State to the amount of Fifty thousand Dollars pursuant to an act of the General assembly of this State entitled "an act to continue the construction of the State Capitol" passed January 24th 1848 and that he deliver the same to John M Bass Prest. of this Round of Commissioners who is hereby authorized to receipt for the same"

closer.name: Jno John W Bass
closer.add:
Prest President of Board of Comissioners Commissioners
The above is a true copy from the minutes
N.A. Glennfeet
